items.abstract: <jats:p>Pregnane analogues of brassinolide and castasterone have been prepared which have an ester function with five carbon atoms at the 20 position. When tested by the bean second internode bioassay, the most efficient substance is <jats:italic>VIII</jats:italic>.</jats:p>
title: Brassinosteroids with Ester Function with Five Carbon Atoms at the 20 Position
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>New brassinolide analogues, characterized by a modified androstane structure without substituent in position 17, were prepared. In the second internode assay, 2α,3α-dihydroxy-B-homo-6-oxa-5α-androstan-7-one (<jats:italic>XVII</jats:italic>) had the highest brassinoid activity.</jats:p>
title: Brassinolide analogues without side chain
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>The synthesis of 2α,3α-dihydroxy-B-homo-7-oxa-cholestan-6-one (<jats:italic>VI</jats:italic>), 2β,3β-dihydroxy-B-homo-7-oxa-5α-cholestan-6-one (<jats:italic>VIII</jats:italic>) and 2α,3α-dihydroxy-B-homo-6-oxa-5α-cholestan-7-one (<jats:italic>XI</jats:italic>) is described. The activity of these brassinosteroids in the bean second internode bioassay is lower than the activity of 24-epibrassinolide (<jats:italic>XXI</jats:italic>).</jats:p>
title: Brassinosteroids with a cholestane side chain
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>: Jasmonic acid (JA) and its related derivatives are ubiquitously occurring compounds of land plants acting in numerous stress responses and development. Recent studies on evolution of JA and other oxylipins indicated conserved biosynthesis. JA formation is initiated by oxygenation of α-linolenic acid (α-LeA, 18:3) or 16:3 fatty acid of chloroplast membranes leading to 12-oxo-phytodienoic acid (OPDA) as intermediate compound, but in Marchantia polymorpha and Physcomitrella patens, OPDA and some of its derivatives are final products active in a conserved signaling pathway. JA formation and its metabolic conversion take place in chloroplasts, peroxisomes and cytosol, respectively. Metabolites of JA are formed in 12 different pathways leading to active, inactive and partially active compounds. The isoleucine conjugate of JA (JA-Ile) is the ligand of the receptor component COI1 in vascular plants, whereas in the bryophyte M. polymorpha COI1 perceives an OPDA derivative indicating its functionally conserved activity. JA-induced gene expressions in the numerous biotic and abiotic stress responses and development are initiated in a well-studied complex regulation by homeostasis of transcription factors functioning as repressors and activators.</jats:p>
title: Jasmonates: News on Occurrence, Biosynthesis, Metabolism and Action of an Ancient Group of Signaling Compounds

items.abstract: <jats:p>Synthesis of brassinosteroids <jats:italic>IIb, d, g, i, k, m, o</jats:italic> and evaluation of their growth-promoting activity is reported. The acid <jats:italic>IIb</jats:italic> shows high activity in both the bean first and second internode assay.</jats:p>
title: Preparation of 2α,3α-dihydroxy-7-oxa-6-oxo-23,24-dinor-B-homo-5α-cholanic acid, its esters and amides as brassinolide analogues
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract:
<jats:p>Some historical and recent attitudes aimed to bioactive inorganic materials are reviewed.
The theory of bridging and non-bridging oxygen is reconsidered as well as the acid and alkali
treatment of titanium surface necessary to achieve a good osteointegration. Some theoretical models
to characterize mechanical properties are also reviewed.</jats:p>
title: Biomedical Thermodynamics and Implantology Aspects of Biocompatible Glass-Ceramics and Otherwise Modified Inorganic Materials and Surfaces

items.abstract: <jats:p>New brassino steroids <jats:italic>XII, XXI</jats:italic>, and <jats:italic>XXIII</jats:italic> were synthesized. These compounds, together with some intermediates of their synthesis, were tested for brassinolide activity. In the bean second internode bioassay, the androstane intermediate <jats:italic>V</jats:italic> exhibited a surprisingly high activity whereas the other tested compounds were substantially less active.</jats:p>
title: Brassino steroids with androstane and pregnane skeleton

items.abstract: <jats:p>The title compound <jats:italic>XVI</jats:italic> was synthesized from <jats:italic>III, IV</jats:italic> or <jats:italic>V</jats:italic>. Related compounds <jats:italic>X, XIII, XVI, XVIII, XXIII, XXIV, XXVII, XXVIII, XXXV, XXXVI, XLI</jats:italic>, and <jats:italic>XLIII</jats:italic> were also prepared and tested by bean second internode bioassay. They showed only low activity (by about 2-3 orders or even lower than 24-epibrassinolide).</jats:p>
title: Alternative syntheses of 2α,3α,17β-trihydroxy-7-oxa-B-homo-5α-androstan-6-one and some androstane brassinolide analogs
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>The synthesis of compounds <jats:italic>VIIIb,c,f,h</jats:italic> and their plant growth-promoting activity is reported. These compounds differ from the previously described substances <jats:italic>Ia-d</jats:italic> by the absence of the 21-methyl group, this structural change resulting in a dramatic decrease in the growth-promoting activity.</jats:p>
title: 2α,3α-Dihydroxy-7-oxa-6-oxo-B-homo-5α-pregnan-21-oic acid and its derivatives as brassinolide analogues
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>Synthesis of a 17a-oxa-17a-homobrassinosteroids, <jats:italic>i.e.</jats:italic> brassinosteroids having two lactone rings, is described. In the bean second internode bioassay, dilactone <jats:bold>16</jats:bold> was the most effective of the compounds synthesized. In the same test, the castasterone analogue <jats:bold>12</jats:bold> exhibited a growth-retarding effect.</jats:p>
title: 17a-Oxa-17a-homobrassinosteroid Analogues
subject: General Chemistry

items.abstract: <jats:p>Analogues of brassinolide and castasterone, containing an ester functionality with four carbon atoms in the position 20 of the pregnane skeleton, have been prepared. In the bean second internode assay the most effective compounds were (20<jats:italic>R</jats:italic>)-2α,3α,20-trihydroxy-5α-pregnan-6-one 20-isobutyrate (<jats:bold>6d</jats:bold>) and (20<jats:italic>R</jats:italic>)-2α,3α,20-trihydroxy-B-homo-7-oxa-5α-pregnan-6-one 20-isobutyrate (<jats:bold>7d</jats:bold>). On the other hand, (20<jats:italic>R</jats:italic>)-2α,3α,20-trihydroxy-B-homo-6-oxa-5α-pregnan-7-one 20-heptafluorobutyrate (<jats:bold>8</jats:bold>) was the first compound with the retarding effect in the same test.</jats:p>
title: Pregnane-Type Brassinosteroids with a Four-Carbon Ester Functionality in Position 20
subject: General Chemistry
